alert.note: Alert for Marathon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 8:59PM CDT until April 15 at 5:17AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Wisconsin River at Rothschild affecting Marathon County. For the Wisconsin River...including Merrill, Wausau, Rothschild, Stevens Point, Wisconsin Rapids...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wisconsin River at Rothschild. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Floodwaters approach a business between Business Highway 51 and the Wisconsin River in Rothschild. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 24.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 27.5 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.5 feet on 06/21/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning.
